ARABIC: ذَٰلِكَ بِمَا قَدَّمَتْ أَيْدِيكُمْ وَأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَيْسَ بِظَلَّٰمٍ لِّلْعَبِيدِ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: That is for what you did. Allah does not wrong His slaves.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: For what you have brought upon yourselves." God is surely not unjust to His creatures, (they are unjust to themselves).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: This is your punishment for what your hands wrought. Allah is not unjust in the least to His creatures.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: This is the result of their deeds. God is not unjust to His servants."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “This is the recompense of what your own hands have sent ahead, and Allah does not oppress His bondmen.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: This is because of that which your hands forwarded. And verily, Allah is not unjust to His servants."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: This is for what your own hands have sent on before, and because Allah is not in the least unjust to the servants;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: that, for what your hands have forwarded, and for that God is never unjust unto His servants.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: This is for that which your own hands have sent before (to the Judgment), and (know) that Allah is not a tyrant to His slaves.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: This is the punishment for what your hands committed -- for, God never does the least wrong to His servants."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: This, because of that which your hands have sent forth, and verily Allah is never unjust unto His creatures.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: That is because of what your hands have sent ahead, and because Allah is not tyrannical to the servants.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Because of (the deeds) which your (own) hands sent forth; for Allah is never unjust to His servants:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: This is because of that which your hands had forwarded. And verily, Allah is not unjust to His slaves."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: That is for what your hands have forwarded, Allah is not unjust to His worshipers'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: “That is because of what your hands have committed, and because God is not unjust to the servants.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: That is for what your hands have put forth [of evil] and because Allah is not ever unjust to His servants."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [8:51] That, chastisement, is for what your hands have sent before you — He refers to this [their actions] exclusively with these [hands], because most actions are accomplished with them — and [know] that God is never unjust to His servants’, such that he would punish them for no sin.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (This is for that which your own hands have sent before (to the Judgement)) this is what your hands have done while you were in a state of idolatry (and (know) that Allah is not a tyrant to His slaves) such that He would take them to task without them having committed a crime.
